member.comment: RxPowerScaling value per RX antenna. Note1: If numOfRxPowerScaling is set to 0, value is taken from vendor specific plan file (as before). Note2: If numOfRxPowerScaling > NUM_OF_RX_ANTENNAS, then these additional values are ignored.
member.name: rxPowerScaling

member.comment: Scaling of the TX IQ data. Defined as Root Mean Square (RMS) average of TX IQ data on RP3 link for maximal output power. For DCM, see "Super 3G BTS FSM/FRR/RF Interface Specification", chapter 2.1.9.
member.name: txPowerScaling

typedef.comment: CC&S Communication Point ID
typedef.name: TCpId

typedef.comment: Instance of managed object class
typedef.name: TMoc

typedef.comment: If the value is zero 0 this means TaTimer in NPF will be used. For TaTimerInfinity pls use value 1.
typedef.name: TRromRadParamTaTimerInfinity

typedef.comment:
CPLANE earfcnDl and earfcnUl offset value to the values of earfcnDl and earfcnUl values that are present in the master configuration file.
This RAD param is for FDD only.
typedef.name: TRromRadParamEarfcnOffset

typedef.comment:
Sign of the CPLANE earfcnDl and earfcnUl offset value to the values of earfcnDl and earfcnUl values
This RAD param is for FDD only. that are present in the master configuration file. If equal to 0 or it is not used in swconfig.txt at all it is positive ( addition of the offset ) otherwise it is negative ( subtraction of the offset )
typedef.name: TRromRadParamEarfcnOffsetSign

typedef.comment: TRUE for global level feature logging
typedef.name: TRromRadDebugLogEnabledGlobal

typedef.comment: TRUE for namespace RROM level feature logging
typedef.name: TRromRadDebugLogEnabledRrom

typedef.comment: TRUE for namespace COMMON level feature logging
typedef.name: TRromRadDebugLogEnabledCommon

typedef.comment: Timer used during Network Plan Activation for buffering RROM_CellStateChangeReq messages
typedef.name: TRromRadCellStateBufferTimer

typedef.comment: Switch on/off backtracing errors for TRom If set to GLO_TRUE, the backtrace is logged for each CPLANE_ERROR.
typedef.name: TRromRadBacktracingErrorsEnable

typedef.comment: Backtrace max events per time period
typedef.name: TRromRadBacktraceMaxEventsPerTimePeriod

typedef.comment: Defines period of time of backtracing errors for CPLANE_ERROR
typedef.name: TRromRadBacktracingErrorsTimePeriod

typedef.comment: Autonomous neighbour relation removal timer period
typedef.name: TRromRadParamAutoNeighRemovalTimerPeriod

typedef.comment: Timer [seconds] started when receiving RROM_HwConfigReq (mapped) and cleared when receiving ENBC_S1L3AvailabilityInd. If timer expires a negative RROM_PlanActivationCompleteInd is sent to BTSOM.
typedef.name: TRromRadS1L3AvailabilityTimer

typedef.comment: Timer [seconds] started when receiving ENBC_S1L3AvailabilityInd. If timer expires a positive RROM_PlanActivationCompleteInd is sent to BTSOM.
typedef.name: TRromRadCellSetupPhaseCompleteTimer

typedef.comment: TRUE to block RF Messages (AntennaCarrier) for Medusa, to keep the original TDD behavior in case of fallback
typedef.name: TRromRadParamBlockRfMessages

member.comment: Network Plan File or Vendor Specific Data File or Actual SCF
member.name: fileType

member.comment: name and location of given file in RAM disk with closing '\0'. lengthOfFileName contains closing '\0'.
member.name: fileName

member.comment: result of req message handling
member.name: status

member.comment: Switch whether BTS shall be reset or not and if so, type of reset that should be executed. "BTS site reset" is not used anymore from INC22 onwards.
member.name: resetRequest

member.comment: Path to the RNW file with the rejected objects due to collision detection during plan file activation.
member.name: rejectedObjectsFile

member.comment: The content of this IE is valid only in case of status = NotOk. This field contains an error description in xml format
member.name: cause

member.comment: Network Plan File or Actual SCF or Full Network Plan File
member.name: fileType

member.comment: name and location in ram disk of the network plan file with closing '\0'. lengthOfNetworkPlanFileName contains closing '\0'.
member.name: networkPlanFile

member.comment: result of req message handling
member.name: status

member.comment: The content of this IE is valid only in case of status = NotOk. This field contains an error description in xml format
member.name: cause

member.comment: defines which phase of the hardware configuration is running. First phase is unmappedLCRs and second phase is mappedLCRs
member.name: configurationPhase

member.comment: HwConfiguration data. Content valid only in case configurationPhase = unmappedLCRs
member.name: unmappedLCRs

member.comment: HwConfiguration data, including RF resources. Content valid only in case configurationPhase = mappedLCRs
member.name: mappedLCRs

member.comment: result of request message handling
member.name: result

member.comment: Mapping between BaseBandUnits (FSPx/FWxx) and LCRs
member.name: hwMapping

member.comment: IP address of DSP selected for the GTP-u data path supervision in FSMr2. In case RROM cannot provide this address because no board has been selected for path supervision it sends all 0s address.
member.name: gtpuDataPathSupervision

member.comment: defines which phase of the hardware configuration change is running (unmapped or mapped) or whether calibrationParametersIds are set
member.name: configurationPhase

member.comment: Content valid only in case configurationPhase = unmappedLCRs
member.name: unmappedLCRs

member.comment: Content valid only in case configurationPhase = mappedLCRs List contains LCRs with changed mapping and LCRs newly mapped to an FSP, but no LCRs with unchanged mapping (list may be empty). If an LCR should not be mapped to an FSP any longer, it is mapped to "INVALID_BOARD" (Glo_bs.h) here. List contains carrier resources of newly mapped LCRs (list may be empty).
member.name: mappedLCRs

member.comment: result of request message handling
member.name: result

member.comment: List contains LCRs with changed mapping and LCRs newly mapped to an FSP. If an LCR should not be mapped to an FSP any longer, it is mapped to "INVALID_BOARD" (Glo_bs.h) here. List does not contain LCRs with unchanged mapping.
member.name: hwMapping

member.comment: IP address of DSP selected for the GTP-u data path supervision (even if it has not changed) for FSMr2. In case RROM cannot provide this address because no board has been selected for path supervision it sends all 0s address.
member.name: gtpuDataPathSupervision

member.comment: Client address where it wants to receive indications
member.name: clientAddress

member.comment: reporting time interval in seconds

member.comment: Bitpattern indicating the subframes eNB receives. Format is d#0: 0: subframe #0 not receive, 1: subframe #0 receive, d#1: 0: subframe #1 not receive, 1: subframe #1 receive … d#9: 0: subframe #9 not receive, 1: subframe #9 receive Dependency also with prachConfigIndex if measType indicates Prach.
member.name: receptionSubframe

member.comment: Bitpattern indicating the subframes signal generator transmit. Bitpattern is subset of receptionSubframeConfig Format is the same as for receptionSubframe.
member.name: expectionSubframe

member.comment: UL Ctrl Channel Meas parameters which are only valid if measType == "Prach".
member.name: prachParams

member.name: puschHarqAckParams

member.name: rootSeqIndex

member.name: prachCS

member.comment: Logical OBSAI/CPRI link which will carry the calibration streams (calibration training sequence in RX calibration and loopbacked sample streams in TX calibration)

member.comment: RxPowerScaling value per RX antenna. Note1: If numOfRxPowerScaling is set to 0, value is taken from vendor specific plan file (as before). Note2: If numOfRxPowerScaling > NUM_OF_RX_ANTENNAS, then these additional values are ignored.
member.name: rxPowerScaling

member.comment: Scaling of the TX IQ data. Defined as Root Mean Square (RMS) average of TX IQ data on RP3 link for maximal output power. For DCM, see "Super 3G BTS FSM/FRR/RF Interface Specification", chapter 2.1.9.
member.name: txPowerScaling

member.comment: to select calibration parameters from Vendor Specific File. If calibrationParametersId = 0, then no calibration parameter instance is selected
